definition:
The term *mapping* is a synonym of , although usage patterns suggest
that “mapping” is the more generic term.

In a geometric context, the term “function” often connotes a mapping
whose purpose is to assign values to the elements of its domain. In
other words, a function defines a field of values. By contrast,
“mapping” has a more geometric connotation, as in “a mapping of one
space to another”.
